title: @ Riot about that CoC nerf & other stuff, have you considered . .
body:
Making CoC scale with bonus health? Will totally prevent the abuse cases like for example Riven taking it, i would be fine with riven taking it if she built a lot of health

**Other Resolve tree changes**

Also why don't we swap unyielding & Legendary guardian, in fact make legendary guardian a tier 2 and the new siegemaster tier 1 since it is only useful in lane
And make a couple small adjustments

Legendary guardian tier2 grants 3-15 armor/mr based on enemies nearby
Unyielding tier 5 Grants bonus armor and magic resist based on 1,5% of bonus health which means {{champion:44}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:33}} {{champion:78}} won't abuse it and it would make it a good mastery on anyone building defense & health
at 2k bonus health which is pretty normal for a full build tank or juggernaut this would grant 30 resistances
Making it scale with bonus health will also prevent abuse cases.

This way Resolve tree will make a lot more sense scaling wise
Early tier masteries grant more flat boosts later tiers scale better with your build & play style similar to how Ferocity and Cunning trees work.

It was intended that this was a mastery that people could take if they wanted to add some windowed durability to their champion without having to compromise their build path to do so (hence why it's not %bonus health). At the same time, we wanted to make the mastery not so generalist that everybody takes it (eg. Strength of Ages). 

I would say your definition of "abuser" in this case is actually something that we desire; sharp masteries that synergise with a subset of champions, but not generally good for everybody. I would imagine in a balanced state that Riven could take any of Fervor (against Tanks for sustained damage), Thunderlords (for quick burst against a squishy) or CoC (if she is facing an assassin and needs to survive) depending on the game. I would agree with you that if CoC is the only mastery that Riven could ever take, then we've failed.

Could the reason for that be grounded in what the two masteries give, respectively?

Fervor gives an ADC straight-up more damage after auto-attacking a bit. At the moment, it takes 10 auto-attacks to get full benefit from the keystone as an ADC, which is quite a lot of ramp-up time - and usually, by the time the ADC got 10 autos off (5 seconds into the fight at least), the fight is already decided.
Warlord's gives Lifesteal, plain and simple. This is extremely interesting for an ADC, as it allows one to forego buying a Vampiric Sceptre (and sinking 900 gold and an item slot into it) till very late in the game, and concentrate all your money towards reaching that crucial two item spike.

Personally, I think that 10 stacks for Fervor and it not stacking on abilities is restricting the mastery too much. Would it be a good idea to scale it back to 8 stacks and/or have ability hits give 2 stacks with a 5 second CD?
Will that be along the lines of more looking into the mastery or looking into the champs?
